files.patch:
@@ -71,10 +71,4 @@ - * associated with each of the keys. - * - *

If the algorithm is the DSA algorithm, and the keysize (modulus - * size) is 512, 768, 1024, or 2048, then the Sun provider uses a set of - * precomputed values for the {@code p}, {@code q}, and - * {@code g} parameters. If the modulus size is not one of the above - * values, the Sun provider creates a new set of parameters. Other - * providers might have precomputed parameter sets for more than just the - * modulus sizes mentioned above. Still others might not have a list of - * precomputed parameters at all and instead always create new parameter sets. + * associated with each of the keys. Information about how the Sun prover + * handles such algorithm-specific parameters can be found in the + * + * JDK Providers Documentation.
